Quickstride looks back at Hydras and shrugs.

" Oh well, we can't change ev=
eryone's mind"

Perpetually on the move and constantly busy. 

On Oct 14, 2=
011, at 7:55 PM, Airshadow Nightstar <airly2002@...> wrote:

> Hydr=
as:
>  
> "I'm the predator not the prey" hissed the male while he showed t=
he device and hadle it at Leo Prime"I'm not easy to defeat" and with a gest=
ure he commanded his troops to be ready for all
>  
>  
> To: nbwrpg@yahoog=
roups.com
> From: magicquartz@...
> Date: Fri, 14 Oct 2011 12:55:53 -=
0400
> Subject: Re: Into the Darkness [Arrivng at the Jungle]
> 
> 
> 
> Qu=
ickstride grins back to Bantor and then takes another listen out toward the=
 jungle.  He notices no movement from the trees or the sounds of birds in t=
he distance.  
> 
> " Strange, no movement by the birds. Usually ya hear th=
em right about now.  I think Air Hammer's right..  Proceed with caution. "
=
> 
> Straight Shot moves nervously while creeping up to Quickstride.
> 
> "=
 Dead calm, Tucson says silence isn't usually bad but on rare occasions it'=
s not good either, this is one of those rare occasions."
> 
> Rattrap sniff=
s but backs away quickly.
> 
> " I don't like what I'm smell'n, trouble is =
out there just wait'n for us ta fall into it's trap.  I'm definitely hang'n=
 back till we get the all clear ta move."
> 
> Perpetually on the move and =
constantly busy. 
> 
> On Oct 14, 2011, at 12:38 PM, Super Cyclonus <superc=
yclonus@...> wrote:
> 
>  
> On 10/13/11, Sandy Panico <magicquartz@y=
ahoo.com> wrote:
> > Quickstride was ready to get serious as was Straight S=
hot, who's quills now
> > stand on end as she postures to get ready for wha=
t lies ahead.
> >
> > " a few quills lodged in their armor should keep them=
 in their place. That's
> > if they even think about coming too close to us=
."
> >
> > Quickstride nods.
> >
> > " True, but I wish we had Uproar on th=
is one, if anyone knows a jungle, it's
> > him. Tigers are natural navigato=
rs when it comes ta dense vegetation.
> > Anyway, Bantor, I think if we kee=
p going East a couple hundred breams , we
> > will make the edge of it's bo=
rder by sunrise."
> >
> > He points to the best possible route.
> 
> <NEW>
=
> 
> There is a smile from BANTOR as he looked at QUICKSTRIDE, "You are a
>=
 beast after my own spark!" He said, his voice almost a snarl, although
> h=
is smile showed that he was not angry but eager and ready to go on
> the mi=
ssion.
> 
> There was grin from NOCTORRO, "Yes, I think we need to go and g=
et in
> there and bust some heads!" He rubbed his hands together.
> 
> AIRH=
AMMER looked over at TORCA and then at BANTOR and NOCTORRO as he
> shook hi=
s head in negation. "Wait." he said shortly.
> 
> (TAG)
> 
> Preston
